name: Regional Music
description: Music of regional cultural traditions, that is or was predominantly played and produced in these regions.

sub_genres.name: African Music
sub_genres.description: All forms with roots in Africa.

sub_genres.name: Ancient Music
sub_genres.description: Umbrella term encompassing all the genres coming after the Prehistoric Music and before the Medieval music eras from ancient civilizations, roughly before 500 CE, following the Western Classical Music point of view with the date of the Roman Empire fall (476 CE).

sub_genres.name: Arabic Music
sub_genres.description: Originating with and primarily performed by the Arab people.

sub_genres.name: Asian Music
sub_genres.description: Rooted in the traditions of Asian peoples.

sub_genres.name: Austronesian Music
sub_genres.description: Music developed by Austronesian ethnic groups.

sub_genres.name: Caribbean Music
sub_genres.description: Meta-genre covering all forms with roots in the Caribbean region.

sub_genres.name: Central American Music
sub_genres.description: Music from the Central American region (including Belize, Costa Rica, El Salvador, Guatemala, Honduras, Nicaragua, and Panama).

sub_genres.name: Christian Liturgical Music
sub_genres.description: Traditionally accompanies church services, as well as extra-liturgical functions such as processionals and sermons.

sub_genres.name: European Music
sub_genres.description: Regional styles with roots in the European continent and surrounding islands.

sub_genres.name: Hispanic Music
sub_genres.description: Music of Hispanic America and Spain, and the genres shared between them.

sub_genres.name: Indigenous American Music
sub_genres.description: Diverse styles and genres developed by the indigenous peoples of the Americas.

sub_genres.name: Islamic Religious Music & Recitation
sub_genres.description: Music and melodic recitation involved in the Islamic faith, such as the reading of the Qur'an with its melodic component (qira'ah), the adhan call to prayer, and the elements often used in the practice of dhikr (particularly in Sufism).

sub_genres.name: Jewish Music
sub_genres.description: Different Jewish forms coming from different regions of the world, influenced by local cultures.

sub_genres.name: Maqāmic Music
sub_genres.description: Originating in the Middle East and founded upon maqāmāt scales, encompassing an extensive and diverse cultural and musical legacy that spans from Morocco to Southeast Asia.

sub_genres.name: Northern American Music
sub_genres.description: Regional styles with roots in Northern America (America north of Mexico, including Canada, United States, Greenland, Saint-Pierre and Miquelon, and Bermuda), typically drawing from European Folk Music and Classical Music as well as West African Music and Indigenous American Music influences.

sub_genres.name: Oceanian Music
sub_genres.description: Rooted in the traditions of the geographic region of Oceania.

sub_genres.name: Polyphonic Chant
sub_genres.description: Chanting that combines two or more melodic lines that are harmonically cohesive but differ in rhythm and utilize non-parallel motion.

sub_genres.name: Prehistoric Music
sub_genres.description: Styles from the first cultural periods of the human species (Homo sapiens, as well as certain Homo neanderthalensis). From its birth in the Paleolithic and Neolithic eras to the Ancient Music era beginning around 2000–3000 BC.

sub_genres.name: South American Music
sub_genres.description: Rooted in the traditions of South America.

sub_genres.name: Sufi Music
sub_genres.description: Covering the various musical traditions of Sufis.

sub_genres.name: Traditional Folk Music
sub_genres.description: Informed by a long history of tradition in a specific culture or region, mostly associated with the peasantry and non-aristocratic public.

sub_genres.name: Turkic-Mongolic Music
sub_genres.description: Group of related traditions which originated among nomadic people of the Central Asian steppes (speakers of Altaic, i.e. Turkic, Mongolic, and Tungusic languages).
